docs.title: ZaeNvim Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the official ZaeNvim documentation site. This guide walks you through installation, configuration, usage, and troubleshooting for a complete NeoVim IDE-like experience.

docs.title: What is ZaeNvim?
docs.text: ZaeNvim is a modern, modular, and beginner-friendly NeoVim configuration that transforms NeoVim into a powerful development environment with minimal setup. It's built for performance, aesthetics, and ease of use.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Intuitive dashboard
  • Fuzzy finding with Telescope
  • Built-in LSP and autocompletion
  • Toggleable floating, horizontal, and vertical terminals
  • Easy-to-read theme (TokyoNight)
  • Keybinding popups with which-key

docs.title: Structure
docs.text:
ZaeNvim is fully modular. Each section of the config is stored in its own Lua file:

  • init.lua — Loads everything
  • lua/core/ — Core settings and options. (The plugins.lua file is in here if you're wondering.)
  • lua/configs/ — Plugin configurations

docs.title: Key Plugins
docs.text: Plugin Description neo-tree.nvim File explorer toggleterm.nvim Terminal manager nvim-lspconfig LSP support mason.nvim LSP/DAP/linter installer nvim-cmp Autocompletion engine LuaSnip Snippet engine treesitter Syntax highlighting/parser telescope.nvim Fuzzy finder lualine.nvim Statusline gitsigns.nvim Git integration Comment.nvim Easy commenting noice.nvim Better UI/notifications alpha-nvim Greeter/dashboard tokyonight.nvim Colorscheme which-key.nvim Keybinding hints

docs.title: NeoVim crashes on launch?
docs.text: Make sure you're using v11.0 or later. Run nvim --version to verify.

docs.title: Plugins not working?
docs.text:
• Ensure lazy.nvim bootstrapped correctly
  • Try running :Lazy sync

docs.title: Key mappings don't work?
docs.text:
• Ensure leader key is <space>
  • Conflicts may exist with other mappings

docs.title: Something else?
docs.text: Open an issue on GitHub or ask in the community!

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• NeoVim 11.0+ (older versions will not work properly)
  • git
  • Optional (Windows): Zig (choco install zig) or GCC via Scoop

docs.title: 1. Backup your current config:
docs.text:
# macOS/Linux
mv ~/.config/nvim ~/.config/nvim.bak

# Windows PowerShell
Rename-Item -Path "$env:LOCALAPPDATA\nvim" -NewName "nvim.bak"

# Windows CMD
cd %LOCALAPPDATA%
ren nvim nvim.bak

docs.title: 2. Clone ZaeNvim:
docs.text:
# macOS/Linux
git clone https://github.com/zaetrix/zaenvim.git ~/.config/nvim/

# Windows
git clone https://github.com/zaetrix/zaenvim.git %LOCALAPPDATA%/nvim

docs.title: 3. Optional: Remove GitHub repo artifacts
docs.text:
# macOS/Linux
cd ~/.config/nvim
rm -rf .git README.md LICENSE

# Windows PowerShell
cd $env:LOCALAPPDATA\nvim
Remove-Item .git, README.md, LICENSE -Force -Recurse

# Windows CMD
cd %LOCALAPPDATA%\nvim
rmdir /s /q .git

docs.title: 4. Launch NeoVim
docs.text:
nvim

Let the plugins install automatically on first run.

docs.title: Key Mappings
docs.text: Use <leader> (spacebar by default) followed by:

docs.title: Terminal
docs.text:
• <leader>tf — Float
  • <leader>th — Horizontal
  • <leader>tv — Vertical
  • <leader>tt — Tab

docs.title: Editing
docs.text:
• <leader>ew — Save
  • <leader>ed — Delete (no yank)
  • <leader>eD — Delete line (no yank)
  • <leader>ep — Paste yank
  • <leader>ey — Yank to clipboard
  • <leader>eu — Undo
  • <leader>er — Redo

docs.title: Tabs
docs.text:
• <leader>nc — Close
  • <leader>nn — New
  • <leader>nl — Next
  • <leader>nh — Previous
  • <leader>ng — Go to #

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• <leader>cf — Find config
  • <leader>cb — Browse folder
  • <leader>cr — Reload
  • <leader>cs — Source session
  • <leader>ce — Edit init.lua

docs.title: Sessions
docs.text:
• <leader>ss — Save
  • <leader>sa — Save As
  • <leader>sr — Restore
  • <leader>sd — Delete
  • <leader>sl — Load by name
